intro: Sinapis arvensis var. longistylosa, commonly known as the long-styled field mustard, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, pinnately lobed leaves. Its flowers are predominantly yellow, and it produces numerous small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. This variant is distinguished by its elongated stamens, which give it its specific epithet "longistylosa."
